bibl.note: 1. Justifying the comparative perspective: 1.1. Differences in cultic organisation between Egypt and Judaea; - 1.2. The high priest of Ptah as compared to the local and provincial high priests of the Seleukid realm; - 1.3. Comparing the economic policies of the Achaemenids and Hellenistic dynasties towards the temples. - 2. The high priests of Ptah in Memphis and the Seleukid provincial high priests: 2.1. The high priest of Ptah in Memphis and the reform of the apomoira; - 2.2. The Seleukid high priests. - 3. The lower-ranking representatives of the royal administration within the temples: 3.1. The increasing grip of the royal administration on the Egyptian temples; - 3.2. Simon the prostates and the Babylonian paqdu. - 4. A hellenistic innovation: meddling with the high priests: 4.1. The high priests of the Egyptian temples under the Ptolemies; - 4.2. The deposition of Onias III by Antiochos IV. - Conclusion.
